answers.author: Stephanie Klinkenberger
answers.text:
Hi Gregory, 
As of the moment, the City of Virginia Beach does not have an employee purchase plan for ipads, but we do offer a program through Microsoft where employees can purchase Microsoft software for their personal computers.  The program is called Microsoft Home Use Program.  Please let me know if you need more details. muniref@vbgov.com

answers.author: Mark Barham
answers.text:
We allow employees who are required to attend City Council meetings to enter into a purchase agreement for iPads where the employee and the City split the cost of the iPad and associated software equally.  This is only for those employees who are required to attend Council meetings and is not open to all employees.

answers.author: Peter Husenitza
answers.text:
We have a PC incentive policy (attached) that enables a $250 amount for employee purchase of any technology related item. Approval from the IT Director is needed to determine workplace benefit to the City. We also encourage the same Microsoft employee application purchases as stated by others.

text: Coon Rapids is looking for organizations that have employee purchasing programs for technology.  They are looking for ways that their employees could personally pay for technology such as ipads. Any ideas?
